p: The EO of the two juniper species was tested for antimicrobial activity against 6 microorganisms using the disc diffusion method, as described in the Materials and Methods section. Overall, the EO of J. sabina was more effective against HI CCM4457 than that of J. excelsa ( Table 8). However, the antimicrobial activity of the EO of the two juniper species did not differ significantly against the other five microorganisms ( Table 8). In general, the best antimicrobial activity of both EOs was found against Escherichia coli and Yersinia enterocolitica (4.80 mm).
